title: Making Year-End Donations? Get the Most Tax Bang for Your Charity Buck
sub_head: New rules for 2021 provide extra tax deductions for charitable giving. But some older rules are worth reviewing too. Here are charitable-deduction strategies to consider before the year ends.
body:
Dec. 31 is the last day for individuals to make tax-deductible charitable donations for 2021.
Congress has made two key changes to enhance tax breaks for giving during the pandemic that expire after this year. One allows millions of taxpayers who wouldnâ€™t normally get a tax break for donations to deduct up to $300 per single filer and $600 per married couple filing jointly. The other allows a full deduction this year for donors making gifts up to 100% of their income, instead of a partial one.
